events.name: Singapore Science Festival: Visual SG: Beauty in Patterns
events.description:
South East Asia’s signature Visualisation Festival, Visual SG, presents a full on visual spectacle of data through the lens of artistic and creative expression. With a line-up of interactive displays, forums and workshops, a highlight includes unwrapping and exploring an Egyptian mummy using an interactive touch table.
 Entry: Admission fees to Science Centre Singapore apply
events.location: Science Centre Singapore, 15 Science Centre Road, Singapore 609081

events.name: Opportunities in Data Analytics and Data Science
events.description:
RSVP for free here: http://ga.co/29XtOcb

Confirmed speakers:
Ping Shung Koo (Data Scientist)
Neeraj Kothari (Senior Manager (Analytics), MOH Holdings Pte Ltd)
Elena Zadnepranets (Senior Data Analyst, Carat Asia Pacific)

Understanding data is becoming increasingly important across all facets of business. Small businesses use financial data to make smarter operating decisions, governments are aggregating data to help us map everything from flu trends to voting information, and corporations are getting more targeted in the way they market products and services.

Our panel of industry insiders will share with you how they got into the industry, and opportunities in this space. Expect to hear answers to these burning questions, and feel free to ask your own!

- What does a Data Analyst / Data Scientist do?
- What’s the difference between a Data Analyst and a Data Scientist?
- How do I get started in this field?
- What are the opportunities in this industry in Singapore?
- What are the practical applications of data science?
- What’s the coolest thing you’ve done with data science in your job?
- What are your favourite tools for analytics and data science?
events.location: IDA Labs @ National Design Centre (111 Middle Road, #03-04), , Singapore

events.name: Papers We Love #021
events.description:
Paper #1: Routing protocols in wireless mesh networks: challenges and design considerations. Waharte S. et al.  http://rboutaba.cs.uwaterloo.ca/Papers/Journals/2006/Sonia06.pdf - Sayanee Basu

Paper #2: An FPGA-Based Transceiver Module - John B. Stephensen https://www.tapr.org/pdf/DCC2010-FPGA-BasedTransceiver-KD6OZH.pdf - Brahim Hamadicharef

-------------------

What was the last paper within the realm of computing/technology you read and loved?

What did it inspire you to build or tinker with? 

Come share the ideas in an awesome academic/research paper with fellow engineers, programmers, and paper-readers. 

Lead a session and show off code that you wrote that implements these ideas or just give us the lowdown about the paper (because of HARD MATH!). Otherwise, just come, listen, and discuss.

-----------------

Original Meetup : http://www.meetup.com/papers-we-love
Papers Repo : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love
Code of Conduct : https://github.com/papers-we-love/papers-we-love/blob/master/CODE_OF_CONDUCT.md
events.location: HackerspaceSG, 344B King George's Avenue, King George's Building, Singapore 208576
